<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Income taxes
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax expense for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was $6.2&nbsp;million, compared with an income tax expense of
	$5.9&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. The increase in income tax expense was mainly due to the increase in taxable income generated from the PRC in fiscal year 2016 compared with fiscal year 2015, and the provision of
	withholding tax applicable to the profits generated by our PRC subsidiaries in fiscal year 2016 that we expect to distribute to our Hong Kong subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Loss from equity method investment
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Loss from equity method investment for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was $91,000, due to share of loss from our investee
	company, Mayi Investment Management.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of the above factors, our net income was $26.3&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, compared to a net
	income of $24.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Fiscal Year Ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 Compared to Fiscal Year Ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2014
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Revenues
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our net revenues increased by 11.3% to $108.2&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $97.2&nbsp;million in the
	fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, primarily as a result of growth in sales of our online education services, books and reference materials, and revenue from other sources.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Online education services
</I>
	. Net revenues from online education services increased by 10.1% to $88.7&nbsp;million in the fiscal year
	ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $80.5&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014. This increase was primarily due to overall modest growth in the total number of our online course enrollments from 3,180,000 in the fiscal year
	ended September&nbsp;30, 2014 to 3,260,000 in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, despite a weaker business environment. In particular, growth in enrollments of healthcare courses and, accounting and engineering&nbsp;&amp; construction
	continuing education courses was partially offset by decreased enrollments from accounting and engineering&nbsp;&amp; construction test preparation courses. See &#147;Item 5.A. Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#150; Operating Results
	&#150; Specific Factors Affecting Our Results of Operations&#148; for the impact of cancellation of Registered Tax Agent qualification and tightening the employment policy of Associate Constructor and Constructor on our revenues. As a result, we
	generated higher revenue in our healthcare, open learning platform and engineering&nbsp;&amp; construction courses, offset by decreased revenue in accounting courses. Our accounting courses continued to account for the majority of our course
	enrollments and revenue. Our accounting courses generated revenues of approximately $48.2&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to approximately $50.0&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
	In addition, our healthcare and engineering&nbsp;&amp; construction courses generated revenues of approximately $25.5&nbsp;million and $8.3&nbsp;million, respectively, in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to $17.1&nbsp;million
	and $7.9&nbsp;million, respectively, in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Books and reference materials
</I>
	. Net revenues
	from sales of books and reference materials increased by 7.5% to $6.9&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $6.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Others
</I>
	. Our net revenues from other sources increased by 23.3% to $12.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015
	from $10.3&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, primarily due to higher revenue from our &#147;Tax School&#148; program and business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training courses. This increase was
	partially offset by decreased revenue in courseware production services and platform production services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Gross Profit
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our gross profit increased by 11.2% to $63.8&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $57.4&nbsp;million in the
	fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014. Our gross margin was 59.0% in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, in line with fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Expenses
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our operating
	expenses increased by 13.0% to $37.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $33.1&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014 for the reasons explained below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	85
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Selling expenses
</I>
	. Our selling expenses increased by 12.8% to $24.2&nbsp;million in the
	fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $21.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014. This increase was primarily due to increased marketing and promotional activities, and rental and related expenses. This increase was
	partially offset by decreased commissions paid to sales agents. As a percentage of our net revenues, however, our selling expenses remained relatively steady at 22.4% of our net revenues in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, as compared
	to 22.1% of our net revenues in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	General and administrative expenses
</I>
	. Our general
	and administrative expenses increased by 13.4% to $13.2&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 from $11.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014. This increase was primarily due to increased rental and
	related expenses, depreciation and share-based compensation expenses. This increase was partially offset by decreased salaries and related expenses due to a decrease in performance-based bonus, and change in bad debts provision. As a percentage of
	our net revenues, our general and administrative expenses remained relatively steady at 12.2% of our net revenues in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, as compared to 12.0% of our net revenues in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Operating Income
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, we had other operating income of $0.2&nbsp;million which was mainly from (i)&nbsp;cash awards
	awarded by the Industry Planning and Development Department of Zhongguancun Haidian Science Park Management Committee; (ii)&nbsp;subsidies received from Shijiazhuang Bureau of Labor Employment Services to our branch company in Shijiazhuang; and
	(iii)&nbsp;cash compensation for infringements of courseware copyrights. In the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, we had other operating income of $0.3&nbsp;million which was mainly from cash awards awarded by Zhongguancun Haidian Science
	Park and subsidies for high and new technology projects from Beijing Science and Technology Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Income taxes
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax expense for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 was $5.9&nbsp;million, compared with an income tax expense of
	$4.1&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014. The increase in income tax expense was mainly due to the increase in taxable income generated from the PRC in fiscal year 2015 compared with fiscal year 2014, and the provision of
	withholding tax applicable to the profits generated by our PRC subsidiaries in fiscal year 2015 that we expect to distribute to our Hong Kong subsidiary. Income tax expenses in fiscal year 2014 included reversal of certain accumulated unpaid income
	tax expense accrued in earlier fiscal years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of the above factors, our net income was $24.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, compared to a net
	income of $23.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Discussion of Segment Operations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the years ended September 2014 and 2015, we operated and managed our business as a single segment that included primarily the provision
	of online and offline education services and selling of related products. During the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, we determined that our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services, previously included in the provision
	of online education services, met the criteria for separate reportable segment given its financial information is separately disclosed by Zhengbao Yucai on the New Third Board and as a result is separately reviewed by our chief operating decision
	maker. Additionally, upon the acquisition of Xiamen NetinNet in fiscal year 2016, Xiamen NetinNet became one operating segment as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. As a result, we determined that for the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, we operated in
	three operating segments, namely online education services, business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services and the sale of learning simulation software.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net revenues from our online education services accounted for 97.2%, 96.6% and 93.7%, respectively, of our total net revenues in the fiscal
	years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016. Net revenues from our business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services accounted for 2.8%, 3.4% and 3.7%, respectively, of our total net revenues in the fiscal years
	ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016. Net revenues from our sale of learning simulation software accounted for nil%, nil% and 2.6%, respectively, of our total net revenues in the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016. See
	&#147;Item 5.A. Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#151; Operating Results &#151; Critical Accounting Policies &#151; Revenue recognition.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	86
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of sales for our online education services primarily consists of salaries and related
	expenses for our tutors, course and content development, website maintenance and information technology technicians and other employees, fees paid to our course lecturers, depreciation and amortization expenses, server management and bandwidth
	leasing fees paid to third-party providers, rental and related expenses, cost of books and reference materials and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of sales for our business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services primarily consists of salaries and related
	expenses for our tutors, website maintenance and information technology technicians, fees paid to our course lecturers, depreciation and amortization expenses, server management and bandwidth leasing fees, rental and related expenses, cost of books
	and reference materials and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of sales for our sale of learning simulation software primarily consists
	of salaries and related expenses for our website maintenance and information technology technicians, amortization expenses, and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling expenses for our online education services primarily consist of salaries and related expenses of our customer service staff and sales
	and marketing staff, commissions paid to our agents, advertising and promotion expenses, rental and related expenses, freight and delivery expenses related to our books and reference materials and promotional materials, and other selling expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling expenses for our business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services primarily consist of salaries and
	related expenses of our sales and marketing staff, rental and related expenses, and other selling expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling expenses for our sale
	of learning simulation software primarily consist of salaries and related expenses of our sales and marketing staff, advertising and promotion expenses, travelling expenses and other selling expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and administrative expenses for our online education services primarily consist of administrative staff compensation and benefits,
	professional fees, depreciation and amortization, rental and related expenses, share-based compensation expenses and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and administrative expenses for our business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services primarily consist of
	administrative staff compensation and benefits, professional fees and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and administrative expenses
	for our sale of learning simulation software primarily consist of administrative staff compensation and benefits, depreciation and amortization, rental and related expenses and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	87
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage90"></A>

<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Fiscal Year Ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 Compared to Fiscal Year Ended September&nbsp;30, 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Revenues of Reportable Segments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Online
	education services.
</I>
	Net revenue from online education services increased by 5.4% to $110.1&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $104.5&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was
	primarily due to the factors discussed in &#147;Item 5.A. Operating and Financial Review and Prospects &#150; Operating Results &#150;Fiscal Year Ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 Compared to Fiscal Year Ended September&nbsp;30, 2015- Net Revenues-
	Online education services, and Books and reference materials&#148;. This increase was partially offset by decreased revenue in our &#147;Tax School&#148; program and offline professional training services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services.
</I>
	Net revenue from business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services increased by 18.6% to $4.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $3.7&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was primarily due to revenue generated from training
	services in Shanghai and Tianjin.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Sale of learning simulation software.
</I>
	Net revenue from the sale of learning simulation software was
	$3.0&nbsp;million for the period from May&nbsp;1, 2016 to September&nbsp;30, 2016. This segment was acquired by us in May 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Costs and
	Expenses of Reportable Segments
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Cost of sales
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Online education services.
</I>
	Cost of sales for online education services increased by 3.4% to $44.5&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $43.0&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was primarily due to increased salaries and related expenses, cost of books and reference materials, and rental and related expenses.
	This increase was partially offset by decreased fees paid to our course lecturers and business tax related to intercompany transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services.
</I>
	Cost of sales for business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services increased by 41.9% to $1.9&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016
	from $1.4&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was primarily due to increased salaries and related expenses, and other miscellaneous expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Sale of learning simulation software.
</I>
	Cost of sales for the sale of learning simulation software was $1.9&nbsp;million for the period from May&nbsp;1,
	2016 to September&nbsp;30, 2016. This segment was acquired by us in May 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Selling expenses
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Online education services.
</I>
	Selling expenses for online education services decreased by 4.4% to $22.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $23.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This decrease was primarily due to decreased commission paid to sales agents. This decrease was partially offset by increased marketing and promotional
	activities, salaries and related expenses, and rental and related expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training
	services.
</I>
	Selling expenses for business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services increased by 15.2% to $0.7&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $0.6&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was primarily due to increased salaries and related expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Sale of learning simulation software.
</I>
	Selling
	expenses for the sale of learning simulation software was $1.3&nbsp;million for the period from May&nbsp;1, 2016 to September&nbsp;30, 2016. This segment was acquired by us in May 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	89
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	General and administrative expense
</I>
</B>
	s
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Online education services.
</I>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	General and administrative expenses for online education services increased by 22.8% to $12.0&nbsp;million in
	the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $9.8&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015. This increase was primarily due to increased salaries and related expenses, rental and related expenses, depreciation, and
	share-based compensation expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services.
</I>
	General and administrative
	expenses for business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services increased by 348.6% to $0.8&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 from $0.2&nbsp;million in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
	2015. This increase was primarily due to increased salaries and related expenses, and professional fees associated with the listing of Zhengbao Yucai on the New Third Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Sale of learning simulation software.
</I>
	General and administrative expenses for the sale of learning simulation software was $0.7&nbsp;million for the
	period from May&nbsp;1, 2016 to September&nbsp;30, 2016. This segment was acquired by us in May 2016.
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	B. Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Historically, we have financed our operations primarily through cash generated internally. On March&nbsp;11, 2014, we completed a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	follow-on
</FONT>
	public offering of ADSs by us and certain selling shareholders. Through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	follow-on
</FONT>
	public offering we issued and sold 1,500,000 ADSs at the price of $21.00 per
	ADS. The net proceeds received by us, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and listing expenses payable by us, amounted to approximately $29.1&nbsp;million. As of September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, we had approximately
	$140.4&nbsp;million, $138.9&nbsp;million and $70.5&nbsp;million in cash and cash equivalents, bank term deposits, restricted cash, and short-term investments, respectively. As of September&nbsp;30, 2016, our cash and cash equivalents of
	$53.7&nbsp;million primarily consisted of cash on hand and bank deposits, and are deposited with banks in China, Hong Kong and United States. We intend to finance our future working capital requirements and capital expenditures in our normal course
	of business from net cash generated from operating activities, existing cash and cash equivalents. We believe that our working capital is sufficient for our present requirements. We do, however, expect to spend money on the further development of
	our &#147;Chinaacc&#148; and &#147;med66.com&#148; brands and other brands in the disciplines for which we offer courses, and strategic acquisition and investment opportunities. See &#147;Item 3.D. Key Information &#151; Risk Factors &#151; Risks
	Relating to Our Business &#151; We may need additional capital but may not be able to obtain it on acceptable terms or at all.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our
	PRC subsidiaries and consolidated affiliated entities, in the aggregate, held RMB450.7&nbsp;million ($67.6 million) in cash and cash equivalents, bank term deposits, restricted cash and short-term investments, as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. For
	information regarding restrictions and potential tax liabilities on profit distribution from these entities, please see &#147;Risk Factors &#151; Risks Relating to Conducting Business in China &#151; PRC regulations relating to investments in
	offshore companies by PRC residents may subject our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	PRC-resident
</FONT>
	beneficial owners or our PRC subsidiaries to liability or penalties, limit our ability to inject capital into our PRC subsidiaries or limit our
	PRC subsidiaries&#146; ability to increase their registered capital or distribute profits&#148;, and &#147;&#151;&nbsp;Restrictions on currency exchange may limit the ability of our PRC subsidiaries and affiliated entities to finance their
	activities.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our PRC subsidiaries and our consolidated affiliated entities generally earn their revenues in Renminbi which is not a
	freely convertible currency. Although our PRC subsidiaries generally may convert Renminbi into foreign currency to pay dividends, our PRC subsidiaries must follow specific procedural requirements which could result in delay or which could change in
	the future. In addition, each of our PRC subsidiaries may pay dividends only out of its accumulated distributable profits, if any, determined in accordance with its articles of association and the accounting standards and regulations in the PRC.
	Pursuant to applicable PRC laws and regulations, 10% of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	profits of each of our PRC subsidiaries are required to be set aside in a statutory surplus reserve fund each year until the reserve
	balance reaches 50% of such PRC subsidiary&#146;s registered capital. Allocations to these statutory reserves may only be used for specific purposes and are not distributable to us in the form of loans, advances or cash dividends. As a result of
	these PRC restrictions, our PRC subsidiaries and consolidated affiliated entities are restricted in their ability to transfer a portion of their net assets to CDEL Cayman (either in the form of dividends, loans or advances), which restricted portion
	as calculated under US&nbsp;GAAP amounted to approximately RMB148.9&nbsp;million ($23.4 million) and RMB160.5&nbsp;million ($24.1 million), respectively, as of September&nbsp;30, 2015 and September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	90
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are a holding company incorporated under the laws of the Cayman Islands. We derive a
	substantial majority of our income from the business operation of our PRC subsidiaries and consolidated affiliated entities in China. Since January&nbsp;1, 2008, dividends derived by foreign enterprises from business operations in China is subject
	to a withholding tax rate of 10% unless any such foreign investor&#146;s jurisdiction of incorporation has a tax treaty with China that provides for a preferential withholding arrangement. For our PRC subsidiaries&#146; earnings generated after 2008
	that were available for distribution, provisions of $0.4&nbsp;million, $0.5&nbsp;million and $0.5&nbsp;million have been made in the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively, for the PRC dividend withholding taxes with
	respect to the distribution of these earnings to CDEL Hong Kong. The economic benefits of our PRC consolidated affiliated entity, Beijing Champion, are mainly transferred to our PRC subsidiaries Champion Education Technology and Champion Technology
	through payment of service fees and licensing fees under the Software License Agreement, Courseware Production Entrustment Agreement, Technical Support and Consultancy Services Agreement and Courseware License Agreement entered into between Beijing
	Champion, Champion Education Technology and Champion Technology. Such service fees and licensing fees are subject to VAT and related surcharges. Upon receipt of such fees, they will become a portion of revenues for Champion Education Technology and
	Champion Technology and can be remitted to the Cayman Islands holding company in the form of dividend distribution. Our other PRC consolidated affiliated entity, Champion Healthcare Education has not started conducting any business to date. As a
	result, no economic benefits of Champion Healthcare Education is available for transfer to our PRC subsidiary, Zhongxi Healthcare Education.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We used part of our cash towards a share repurchase program we implemented from August&nbsp;18, 2015 to August&nbsp;17, 2016. The program
	authorized us to repurchase up to $40.0&nbsp;million worth of our issued and outstanding ADSs from time to time in open market transactions on the NYSE. For more details, see &#147;Item 16.E. Purchases of Equity Securities by the Issuer and
	Affiliated Purchasers.&#148; In the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, we repurchased 2,831,615 ADSs on the open market for a consideration of $36.7&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table summarizes our cash flows in the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	CDEL Cayman, our ultimate holding company, may rely on dividends and other distributions on equity paid by our
	PRC subsidiaries for its cash requirements, but such dividends and other distributions are subject to restrictions under PRC law. See Note&nbsp;17 to our consolidated financial statements included in this annual report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Operating activities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of
	$39.0&nbsp;million generated from operating activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;net income before
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	items including share-based
	compensation expenses, depreciation and amortization, reduction in provision of obsolete inventories and reduction in allowance for doubtful accounts, (ii)&nbsp;increase in accrued expenses and other liabilities of $3.8&nbsp;million,
	(iii)&nbsp;increase in income tax payable of $0.9&nbsp;million, and (iv)&nbsp;increase in deferred revenue of $8.2&nbsp;million. The increase in operating cash flow was partially offset by (i)&nbsp;increase in prepayments and other assets of
	$0.8&nbsp;million, (ii)&nbsp;increase in other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-current
</FONT>
	assets of $1.2&nbsp;million, and (iii)&nbsp;decrease in refundable fees of $4.2&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	91
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $37.8&nbsp;million generated from operating activities in the fiscal year ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2015 was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;net income before
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	items including share-based compensation expenses, depreciation and amortization, provision of obsolete inventories,
	interest on bank borrowing and reduction in allowance for doubtful accounts, (ii)&nbsp;decrease in deferred tax assets of $0.5&nbsp;million, (iii)&nbsp;increase in accrued expenses and other liabilities of $3.5&nbsp;million, (iv)&nbsp;increase in
	deferred revenue and refundable fees of $7.3&nbsp;million, and (v)&nbsp;increase in deferred tax liabilities of $0.5&nbsp;million. The increase in operating cash flow was partially offset by increase in inventories, and prepayments and other assets
	of $0.5&nbsp;million and $1.3&nbsp;million, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $44.1&nbsp;million generated from operating activities in the
	fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014 was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;net income before
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	items including share-based compensation expenses, depreciation and amortization, provision of
	obsolete inventories, and reduction in allowance for doubtful accounts, (ii)&nbsp;decrease in accounts receivable of $2.4&nbsp;million, (iii)&nbsp;decrease in deferred costs of $0.6&nbsp;million, (iv)&nbsp;increase in accrued expenses and other
	liabilities of $7.9&nbsp;million, and (v)&nbsp;increase in deferred revenue and refundable fees of $7.2&nbsp;million. The increase in operating cash flow was partially offset by increase in other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-current
</FONT>
	assets of $0.6&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investing activities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $34.0&nbsp;million used in investing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was primarily attributable to
	(i)&nbsp;acquisition of Xiamen NetinNet of $29.7&nbsp;million (net of cash acquired), (ii) strategic investments of $3.7&nbsp;million in total in Mayi Investment Management, Amdon, Niuke Technology, and Nurselink Int&#146;1, and (iii)&nbsp;capital
	expenditure of $3.9&nbsp;million. The decrease in cash flow was partially offset by the release of term deposits of $4.6&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $4.3&nbsp;million used in investing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 was primarily attributable to
	capital expenditure of $4.9&nbsp;million. The decrease in cash flow was partially offset by the release of term deposits of $0.8&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $24.2&nbsp;million used in investing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014 was primarily attributable to
	(i)&nbsp;the pledge of $16.3&nbsp;million in term deposit placed with a financial institution to secure a RMB100&nbsp;million ($16.3 million) term loan facility, (ii)&nbsp;the purchase of term deposits of $4.9&nbsp;million, and (iii)&nbsp;capital
	expenditure of $2.7&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Financing activities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $62.9&nbsp;million used in financing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 was primarily attributable to
	(i)&nbsp;payment of a special dividend of $31.1&nbsp;million, (ii)&nbsp;repurchase of our ADSs on the open market for a consideration of $36.8&nbsp;million. The decrease in cash flow was partially offset by the proceeds of share issuance of Zhengbao
	Yucai to selected directors, officers and employees of RMB31.7&nbsp;million ($4.9 million) in January 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of
	$29.9&nbsp;million used in financing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015 was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;payment of a special dividend of $28.2&nbsp;million, and (ii)&nbsp;repurchase of our ADSs on the open market for
	a consideration of $3.3&nbsp;million. The decrease in cash flow was partially offset by repayment of a $1.0&nbsp;million loan by optionees in connection with exercise of their options.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash of $26.1&nbsp;million generated from financing activities in the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2014 was primarily attributable
	to (i)&nbsp;the net proceeds of $29.1&nbsp;million from our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	follow-on
</FONT>
	public offering, (ii)&nbsp;a $16.3&nbsp;million (RMB100 million) term loan facility from a financial institution, and (iii)&nbsp;repayment
	of a $1.2&nbsp;million loan by optionees in connection with exercise of their options. The increase in cash flow was partially offset by payment of a special dividend of $20.3&nbsp;million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Capital Expenditures
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We incurred capital
	expenditures of $2.7&nbsp;million, $4.9&nbsp;million and $3.9&nbsp;million in the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively. The amount of capital expenditures in the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and
	2016 related primarily to our expenditures on property, plant and equipment, and software. From time to time, we may evaluate and make investments, acquisitions or divestments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	92
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We believe that our current cash and cash equivalents, and anticipated cash flows from operations
	will be sufficient to meet our anticipated working capital requirements and capital expenditures in normal course of business for 12 months following the date of this annual report. Our online course platform can support significant growth in course
	enrollments and is easily adapted for the addition of new courses. We do, however, expect to spend money on the further development of our &#147;Chinaacc&#148; and &#147;med66.com&#148; brands and other brands in the disciplines for which we offer
	courses, and strategic acquisition and investment opportunities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, we may require additional sources of liquidity in the event
	of changes in business conditions or other future developments. Factors affecting our sources of liquidity include, for example, our sales performance, ability to control costs and expenses, choice of financing arrangements and mergers and
	acquisitions. Any changes in the significant factors affecting our revenues from education services may cause material fluctuations in our cash generated from operations. See &#147;Operating Results &#151; Overview &#151; Specific Factors Affecting
	Our Results of Operations&#148; for a description of these significant factors. Changes in working capital, including any significant shortening or lengthening of our accounts receivable cycle or customer prepayment cycles, may also cause
	fluctuations in our cash generated from operations. If our sources of liquidity are insufficient to satisfy our cash requirements, we may seek to sell additional equity or debt securities to meet our cash needs. The sale of convertible debt
	securities or additional equity securities could result in dilution to our shareholders. In addition, convertible debt securities would incur significant interest expense. The incurrence of indebtedness would result in debt service obligations and
	could result in operating and financial covenants that restrict our operations. We cannot assure you that future financing will be available in amounts or on terms acceptable to us, if at all.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Current PRC regulations permit our PRC subsidiaries to pay dividends to us only out of their accumulated profits, if any, determined in
	accordance with PRC accounting standards and regulations. However, our PRC subsidiaries are required under PRC laws and regulations to allocate a portion of their annual
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	profits, if any, to certain
	statutory reserves and funds prior to declaring and remitting dividends. For example, our PRC subsidiaries are required to allocate at least 10% of their
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	after-tax
</FONT>
	profits to statutory reserves each year until
	such reserves reach 50% of their respective registered capital. Allocations to these statutory reserves and funds can be used only for specific purposes and are not transferable to us in the form of loans, advances or cash dividends. As a result,
	our PRC subsidiaries are restricted in their ability to transfer a portion of their net assets to us. Such limitations on the ability of our PRC subsidiaries to transfer funds to us could materially and adversely affect our ability to grow, make
	investments or acquisitions, pay dividends, and otherwise fund and conduct our businesses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Inflation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the National Bureau of Statistics of China, the change in China&#146;s Consumer Price Index was 2.0% and 1.4% in the years 2014
	and 2015, respectively. Inflation has had some impact on our operations in recent years, particularly in the form of higher salaries for our lecturers, and employees. For more details, see &#147;Item 5.A. Operating and Financial Review and Prospects
	&#151; Operating Results &#151; Description of Key Line Items &#151; Cost of Sales, Selling Expenses, and General and Administrative Expenses.&#148; We can provide no assurance that we will not continue to be affected in the future by higher rates
	of inflation in China, or that we will be able to adjust our fees to mitigate the impact of inflation on our results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	C. Research and
	Development, Patents and Licenses, Etc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Research and development does not constitute a material part of our business and we do not
	incur any material expenses related to research and development.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	D. Trend Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other than as disclosed elsewhere in this annual report, we are not aware of any trends, uncertainties, demands, commitments or events for the
	year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on our revenues, income, profitability, liquidity or capital resources, or that caused the disclosed financial information to be not necessarily
	indicative of future operating results or financial conditions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	E.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Off-Balance
</FONT>
	Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We do not currently have, and do not expect in the future to have, any outstanding
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	off-balance
</FONT>
	sheet
	arrangements or commitments. In our ongoing business, we do not plan to enter into transactions involving, or otherwise form relationships with, unconsolidated entities or financial partnerships established for the purpose of facilitating
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	off-balance
</FONT>
	sheet arrangements or commitments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	F. Tabular Disclosure of Contractual Obligations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Contractual Obligations and Commercial Commitments
</B>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	(1)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Our operating lease obligations primarily relate to our leased servers and bandwidth as well as our leased offices and staff quarters in China and Hong Kong. The office and staff quarter leases expire at different times
	over the period from the date of this annual report through 2021 and will become subject to renewal. We will evaluate the need to renew each office and staff quarter lease on a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	case-by-case
</FONT>
</FONT>
	basis prior to its expiration.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(2)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Liabilities for unrecognized tax benefits. The balance disclosed under &#147;Others&#148; represents liabilities for which reasonable estimates about the timing of the payment cannot be made.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	(3)
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	CDEL Cayman drew down a loan of RMB103.6&nbsp;million from a bank. The loan is effective from June&nbsp;24, 2015 to June&nbsp;24, 2016 for a period of 12 months. The loan was renewed and extended to June&nbsp;24, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Indebtedness
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	June&nbsp;22, 2015, CDEL Cayman entered into a loan agreement with a bank for a RMB300&nbsp;million ($45.0 million)
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	3-year
</FONT>
	revolving term loan facility. RMB103.6&nbsp;million ($15.5 million) of the facility
	was drawn down on June&nbsp;24, 2015 with a 3.625% annual interest rate for a term of 12 months. The facility was secured by a term deposit of RMB103.6&nbsp;million ($15.5 million) provided by Champion Technology. The loan was renewed and extended
	to June&nbsp;24, 2017 with a 3.0% annual interest rate, subject to adjustment each quarter. The loan was replaced by a loan of $14.9&nbsp;million from the same bank on December&nbsp;23, 2016 with a 1.99706% annual interest rate, subject to
	adjustment each quarter. Additional term deposit of RMB11.6&nbsp;million ($1.7 million) was provided by Champion Technology as a security for such new loan. In addition, $15.0&nbsp;million of the facility was drawn down on December&nbsp;23, 2016
	with a 1.99706% annual interest rate, subject to adjustment each quarter, for a term of 12 months. The facility was secured by a term deposit of RMB116.7&nbsp;million ($17.5 million) provided by Champion Technology.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	G. Safe Harbor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This report contains
	forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section&nbsp;27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section&nbsp;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of
	1995. See &#147;Introduction &#151; Forward-Looking Statements.&#148;
</P>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	94
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Zhengdong Zhu
</I>
	is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-founder,
</FONT>
	chairman of the board
	and chief executive officer of our company and is responsible for the overall management operations and strategic direction of our company. Prior to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-founding
</FONT>
	our company in 1998, Mr.&nbsp;Zhu worked at the
	Beijing Huake
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Hi-Tech
</FONT>
	Co., Ltd., a communications products and computer facilities company, as an engineer, manager of network department and vice general manager in charge of marketing and sales from 1995 to
	1998. From 1989 to 1995, Mr.&nbsp;Zhu worked as an engineer in the area of electronic communications technology at the research department of North China Institute of Electro-Optics Technology. Mr.&nbsp;Zhu graduated from the Radio Engineering
	Department of the Southeast University in China with a bachelor&#146;s degree in radio engineering in 1989, and obtained a graduate certificate from the management science department in Sichuan University in China in 2001. Mr.&nbsp;Zhu received his
	EMBA degree from Tsinghua University in 2011. Mr.&nbsp;Zhu and Ms.&nbsp;Baohong Yin, our director and deputy chairman, are husband and wife.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Baohong Yin
</I>
	is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-founder,
</FONT>
	director and deputy chairman of our company. From 1989 to 2004,
	Ms.&nbsp;Yin worked as engineer, vice director of laboratory, senior engineer, director of laboratory and vice-general engineer at Beijing
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Uni-Construction
</FONT>
	Dadi Concrete Building Components Co., Ltd
	(previously known as Beijing Residential Construction Component Manufacturer). Ms.&nbsp;Yin graduated in 1989 from the Civil Engineering Department of Southeast University in China with a bachelor&#146;s degree in civil engineering. She was also
	conferred the qualification as a senior engineer by the Beijing Advanced Specialized Technology Committee in 1999. Ms.&nbsp;Yin received her EMBA degree from Beijing University in 2010. Ms.&nbsp;Yin and Mr.&nbsp;Zhengdong Zhu, our chairman and chief
	executive officer, are wife and husband.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Feijia Ji
</I>
	is senior executive vice president of our company. From 1996 to 2000,
	Mr.&nbsp;Ji worked as a marketing manager at the Beijing Huake
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Hi-Tech
</FONT>
	Co., Ltd. From 1995 to 1996, Mr.&nbsp;Ji worked as a business manager at Huayou Beijing Service Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Ji graduated from
	Beijing Xicheng Workers University in 1996. Mr.&nbsp;Ji received his EMBA degree from Tsinghua University in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Xiaoshu Chen
</I>
	is
	an independent director of our company, and currently a professor and an assistant director at the Department of Radio Engineering of SISE Southeast University in China. From 1985 to 2001, Professor Chen worked as an assistant lecturer, lecturer and
	assistant professor at the same department. Professor Chen has almost 20 years of experience in communication systems and network research. He graduated in 1985 from the Department of Radio Engineering of the Nanjing Institute of Technology in China
	with a bachelor&#146;s degree in engineering. He obtained his master&#146;s degree in engineering in 1990 from the same university.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Annabelle Yu Long
</I>
	is an independent director of our company.&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Long currently serves as a member of Bertelsmann Group
	Management Committee, Chief Executive Officer of Bertelsmann China Corporate Center and Managing Partner of Bertelsmann Asia Investments. Formerly, Ms.&nbsp;Long was a Principal at Bertelsmann Digital Media Investments. She joined the international
	media, services, and education company via the Bertelsmann Entrepreneurs Program in 2005. From 1996 to 2003, Ms.&nbsp;Long was a Producer and Lead Anchor for the Sichuan Broadcasting Group. From 1994 to 1996 she was a Producer and host for Chengdu
	People&#146;s Radio Broadcasting. Ms.&nbsp;Long is an active member of the World Economic Forum&#146;s Young Global Leaders Advisory Council and is also a member of its Global Agenda Council on the Future of Media, Entertainment&nbsp;&amp;
	Information. In addition, she is a member of the Stanford Graduate School of Business Advisory Council. Ms.&nbsp;Long serves on the Board of Directors of both Coach Inc. (NYSE: COH) and BitAuto (NYSE: BITA).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Liankui Hu
</I>
	is an independent director of our company. He had served as chairman on the boards of directors of the following technology
	companies since 1998 to 2016, Beijing Teamsun Technology Co., Ltd., and Beijing Huasun Mingtian Technology Co. Ltd. From 1987 to 1998, Mr.&nbsp;Hu had worked for the Sixth Electronics Institute of the Ministry of Information Industry as deputy
	president, for Beijing Shenyan System Co., Ltd. as general manager, and for Beijing Huasun Computer Co., Ltd. as general manager. He was a lecturer in School of Economics and Management, Tsinghua University in China from 1985 to 1987. Mr.&nbsp;Hu
	received his bachelor&#146;s degree in engineering from Radio Engineering Department of Tsinghua University in 1982, and his master&#146;s degree from School of Economics and Management of Tsinghua University in 1985.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	95
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Carol Yu
</I>
	is an independent director of our company. From 2004 to 2016, Ms.&nbsp;Yu served
	as President and Chief Financial Officer of Sohu.com Inc. an internet company listed on Nasdaq, as well as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Executive Officer of Changyou.com Limited, Sohu&#146;s Nasdaq-listed gaming subsidiary. Prior
	to joining Sohu, Ms.&nbsp;Yu worked at Donaldson Lufkin&nbsp;&amp; Jenrette Securities Corporation and Arthur Andersen&nbsp;&amp; Co. Ms.&nbsp;Yu obtained her bachelor&#146;s degree in accounting from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Mark Marostica
</I>
	is our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Financial Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Marostica joined our company as vice
	president of corporate development and strategy in January 2015. He has over 15 years of experience in the capital markets, with a focus on Asian education and Internet companies. Before joining our company, he was a managing director and senior
	research analyst at Piper Jaffray&nbsp;&amp; Company from 1998 to 2014, and served as managing director and head of Asia equity research from 2009 to 2012. Prior to that he was a consulting manager at Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche from 1994 to 1998.
	Earlier in his career Mark served as an information technology manager at Fortis, and as an analyst at Electronic Data Systems. Mark holds a master degree in Business Administration from University of St. Thomas in Saint Paul, and an Honours
	Bachelor of Commerce degree from Lakehead University in Canada.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Philip Chan
</I>
	is our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Financial Officer. Mr.&nbsp;Chan has been our company&#146;s financial controller since 2005 and has had overall responsibility for financial and accounting matters. He has over 19 years of accounting
	and auditing experience and is a Certified Public Accountant of the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants, and associate of the Association of International Accountants. He received a Master degree in Applied Finance from the
	University of Western Sydney in 2002.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	B. Compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Compensation of Directors and Executive Officers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, we and our subsidiaries paid aggregate cash compensation of approximately $0.9&nbsp;million
	to our directors and executive officers as a group. We do not pay or set aside any amounts pursuant to a bonus plan or for pension, retirement or other benefits for our officers and directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Share Options, Restricted Shares and Share Incentive Plans
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We adopted our Share Incentive Plan, or the Prior Plan, on April&nbsp;18, 2008. We adopted on July&nbsp;2, 2008, and amended and restated on
	February&nbsp;16, 2009 and May&nbsp;21, 2012, respectively, our 2008 Performance Incentive Plan, or the New Plan. Our incentive plans are intended to promote our success and to increase shareholder value by providing an additional means to attract,
	motivate, retain and reward selected directors, officers, employees, lecturers and other eligible persons. An aggregate of 11,652,556 ordinary shares are reserved for issuance under the Prior Plan. Subject to any amendment of the New Plan, the
	maximum number of ordinary shares that may be issued pursuant to the New Plan is 23,642,518 ordinary shares as of September&nbsp;30, 2016, plus an automatic annual increase on October&nbsp;1 of each calendar year commencing from October&nbsp;1,
	2016, by an amount equal to the lesser of (i)&nbsp;2% of the total number of ordinary shares issued and outstanding on September&nbsp;30 of the same calendar year, (ii)&nbsp;2,850,000 ordinary shares, or (iii)&nbsp;such number of ordinary shares as
	may be determined by our board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Prior Plan, we had granted options for the purchase of a total of 11,045,500
	ordinary shares to selected officers, employees, and lecturers as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. Pursuant to the New Plan, we had granted options for the purchase of a total of 5,962,500 ordinary shares and issued 1,299,515 restricted shares to five
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-executive
</FONT>
	directors, officers and selected employees as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there were outstanding options to purchase 2,140,600 ordinary shares, out of which options to
	purchase approximately 980,600 ordinary shares have vested under their current terms. We expect to recognize share-based compensation expenses for the remaining vesting period of the outstanding options and restricted shares, which may continue to
	impact our future results of operations. During the fiscal years of September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, we recognized share-based compensation expenses of $0.5&nbsp;million, $1.8&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	96
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On September&nbsp;27, 2011 and November&nbsp;11, 2015, we determined to provide three-year
	interest free, full recourse loans to employees and lecturers to exercise their options. On August&nbsp;13, 2014, August&nbsp;18, 2015 and August&nbsp;23, 2016, we determined to extend part of the loan due on December&nbsp;4, 2014, November&nbsp;27,
	2015 and October&nbsp;31, 2016 for an additional three years to December&nbsp;4, 2017, November&nbsp;27, 2018 and October&nbsp;31, 2019, respectively. As of September&nbsp;30, 2016, 7,910,668 options had been exercised using this facility, amounting
	to a total loan amount of $6.5&nbsp;million. The outstanding balance of the loan was $3.7&nbsp;million as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	November&nbsp;18, 2014 and November&nbsp;11, 2015, we declared a cash dividend of $0.20, and $0.225 per ordinary share on our outstanding shares to shareholders of record as of the close of trading on January&nbsp;6, 2015 and January&nbsp;6, 2016,
	respectively, and reduced the exercise price of all our outstanding options under our Prior Plan and New Plan by the same amount per share accordingly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;18, 2014, we granted 2,800,000 options to employees at an exercise price of $3.7425 per share under the New Plan, which
	equaled the per share value of our ADS on the NYSE at the close of trading on November&nbsp;18, 2014. The vesting term of the options granted to employees is a four-year period, with four equal annual installments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;12, 2015, we issued 542,372 restricted ordinary shares to an employee under the New Plan. The vesting term of the restricted
	ordinary shares is a four-year period, with 25% vesting on the first anniversary of the issue date and the remaining 75% vesting in six substantially equal semi-annual installments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Options granted under our share incentive plans generally do not vest unless the grantee remains under our employment or in service with us on
	the given vesting date. Generally, if the grantee&#146;s employment or service with us is terminated for cause, all such grantee&#146;s options under our share incentive plans, vested and unvested, immediately terminate and become unexercisable. On
	the other hand, if the grantee&#146;s employment or service with us is terminated for any reason other than for cause, all such grantee&#146;s vested options terminate and become unexercisable ninety days following the grantee&#146;s last day of
	employment or service with us. In circumstances where there is a death or disability of the grantee, generally all unvested options immediately terminate and become unexercisable while vested options terminate and become unexercisable twelve months
	after the last date of employment or service with us. Generally, all unvested options granted under the Plan become fully vested immediately upon a change in the control of our company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our board of directors may amend, alter, suspend, or terminate our share incentive plans at any time, provided, however, that our board of
	directors must first seek the approval of the participants of our share incentive plans if such amendment, alteration, suspension or termination would adversely affect the rights of participants under any option granted prior to that date. Without
	further action by our board of directors, both Prior Plan and the New Plan will terminate in 2018.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	97
</P>

	executive officers pursuant to our share incentive plans:

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

	November&nbsp;17,

	2024

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	C. Board Practices
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Duties of Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under Cayman Islands
	law, our directors have a duty of loyalty to act honestly in good faith with a view to our best interests. Our directors also have a duty to exercise the care, diligence and skills that a reasonably prudent person would exercise in comparable
	circumstances. In fulfilling their duty of care to us, our directors must ensure compliance with our second amended and restated memorandum of association and articles of association. A shareholder has the right to seek damages if a duty owed by our
	directors is breached.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	100
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The functions and powers of our board of directors include, among others:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	convening shareholders&#146; meetings and reporting its work to shareholders at such meetings;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Terms of Executive Officers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All of our
	executive officers are appointed by and serve at the discretion of our board of directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Terms of Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We currently have a board of seven directors divided into class A, class B and class C directors. Mr.&nbsp;Feijia Ji is the class A director.
	The class B directors are Ms.&nbsp;Baohong Yin, Ms.&nbsp;Annabelle Yu Long and Mr.&nbsp;Xiaoshu Chen. The class C directors are Mr.&nbsp;Zhengdong Zhu, Ms.&nbsp;Carol Yu and Mr.&nbsp;Liankui Hu. One third of the directors (or, if their number is not
	a multiple of three (3), the number nearest to but not greater than one third) will retire from office and stand for election every year at our annual general meeting of shareholders on a rotating basis. At our 2016 annual general meeting,
	Ms.&nbsp;Annabelle Yu Long and Mr.&nbsp;Xiaoshu Chen were
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-elected
</FONT>
	as class B directors. Our chief executive officer, which currently is Mr.&nbsp;Zhengdong Zhu, is not, while holding office, subject to
	retirement or be taken into account in determining the number of directors to retire in any year. There are no director service contracts with us or any of our subsidiaries and affiliated entities providing for benefits upon termination of
	employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Board Practices
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our
	board of directors has established an audit committee, a compensation committee and a nomination committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Audit Committee
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our audit committee consists of Ms.&nbsp;Carol Yu, Mr.&nbsp;Liankui Hu and Mr.&nbsp;Xiaoshu Chen. Ms.&nbsp;Carol Yu is the chairman of our
	audit committee. Our board of directors has determined that all of our audit committee members satisfy the &#147;independence&#148; requirements of relevant rules of the NYSE and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Rule10A-3
</FONT>
	under the Securities
	Exchange Act of 1934. Ms.&nbsp;Carol Yu meets the criteria of an audit committee financial expert as set forth under the applicable rules of the SEC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our audit committee is responsible for, among other things:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	appointing the independent auditor;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-approving
</FONT>
	all auditing and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-auditing
</FONT>
	services permitted to be performed by the independent auditor;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	setting clear hiring policies for employees and former employees of the independent auditor;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	reviewing with the independent auditor any audit problems or difficulties and management&#146;s responses;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	reviewing and approving all related party transactions on an ongoing basis;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	reviewing and discussing with management and the independent auditor major issues regarding accounting principles and financial statement presentations;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
