<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, 2015 AND 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(In thousands, except share and per share data, or otherwise noted)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	19.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	EMPLOYEE DEFINED CONTRIBUTION PLAN
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Full time employees of the Group in the PRC
	participate in a government mandated defined contribution plan, pursuant to which certain pension benefits, medical care, employee housing fund and other welfare benefits are provided to employees. Chinese labor regulations require that the PRC
	subsidiaries of the Group make contributions to the government for these benefits based on certain percentages of the employees&#146; salaries. The Group has no legal obligation for the benefits beyond the contributions made. The total amounts for
	such employee benefits, which were expensed as incurred, were US$5,331, US$6,432 and US$7,113 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Obligations for contributions to defined contribution retirement plans for full-time employee in Hong Kong, including contributions payable
	under the Hong Kong Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance, are recognized as expenses in the consolidated statements of operations as incurred. The total amounts for such employee benefits were US$2, US$3 and US$3 for the years ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Legal contingencies
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The group is a party in potential claims arising in the ordinary course of business. The Group does not believe that the resolution of these
	matters will have a material effect on its financial position or results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Assets pledged as security for bank
	borrowing
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As disclosed in Note 15, on June&nbsp;24, 2016, CDEL Cayman entered into a loan agreement for a RMB103.6&nbsp;million
	(US$15,542) term loan facility. The facility was secured by a term deposit of RMB103.6&nbsp;million provided by Champion Technology, which was recorded as &#147;restricted cash&#148; on the consolidated balance sheet as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	NONCONTROLLING INTERESTS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Noncontrolling interests represent the portion of equity in a
	subsidiary not attributable, directly or indirectly, to a parent. The accompanying consolidated financial statements include all assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses at their consolidated amounts, which include the amounts attributable to the
	Company and the noncontrolling interest. The Company recognizes as a separate component of equity and earnings on the portion of income or loss attributable to noncontrolling interests based on the portion of the entity not owned by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table presents the changes in the Company&#146;s noncontrolling interests during the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014,
	2015 and 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage185"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHINA DISTANCE EDUCATION HOLDINGS LIMITED
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, 2015 AND 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(In thousands, except share and per share data, or otherwise noted)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	21.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	NONCONTROLLING INTERESTS - continued
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2016, the Group sold a 39.94% ownership of Zhengbao Yucai to a limited partnership
	entity, Beijing Champion Tongxin Management Consulting LLP (&#147;Tongxin&#148;), for a cash consideration of US$4,824. Mr Zhengdong Zhu, holds 53.11% interest of the partnership and serves as a co-general partner. All the partners in Tongxin are
	employees of the Group. The entire cash consideration was fully paid by the investors as of September&nbsp;30, 2016. As the Group retained control over Zhengbao Yucai subsequent to the above transactions, the disposal was accounted as an equity
	transaction in the Group&#146;s consolidated financial statements. Subsequent to the transaction, the Group&#146;s interest over Zhengbao Yucai was diluted to 60.06% as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In May 2016, the Group acquired an 80% of equity interest in NetinNet. The noncontrolling interest of 20% equity interest over NetinNet has
	been included in the consolidated financial statements as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	22.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SEGMENT REPORTING
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group&#146;s chief operating decision maker has been identified
	as the Chief Executive Officer who reviews U.S. GAAP financial information of its operating segments when making decisions about allocating resources and assessing the performance of the Group. During the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2015, the
	Group operated and managed its business as a single reporting segment which included the provision of online and offline education services and selling of related products. During the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, the Group determined that its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services, previously included in the provision of online education services, met the criteria for separate reportable segment given its financial information is separately disclosed by
	Zhengbao Yucai on the New Third Board and as a result is separately reviewed by the Group&#146;s chief operating decision maker. Additionally, upon the acquisition of NetinNet in the current year, NetinNet became one operating segment as of
	September&nbsp;30, 2016. As a result, the Group determined that for the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, the Group operated in three operating segments namely the online education services, business
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	start-up
</FONT>
	training services and the sale of learning simulation software. The changes in reportable segments were reflected in the historical periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group primarily operates in the PRC and substantially all of the Group&#146;s long-lived assets are located in the PRC.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-58
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHINA DISTANCE EDUCATION HOLDINGS LIMITED
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, 2015 AND 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(In thousands, except share and per share data, or otherwise noted)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	24.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHARE INCENTIVE PLAN
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Share options
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April&nbsp;18, 2008, the Company&#146;s shareholders approved the &#147;China Distance Education Holdings Limited Share Incentive Plan&#148;
	(the &#147;Prior Plan&#148;), which permits the grant of share options and shares to its employees and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-employees
</FONT>
	(the &#147;Participants&#148;). The maximum number of ordinary shares that may be delivered
	pursuant to compensatory awards granted to the &#147;Participants&#148; under the Prior Plan should not exceed 11,652,556 ordinary shares of par value US$0.0001 per share. On July&nbsp;2, 2008, the Company&#146;s shareholders approved the
	&#147;China Distance Education Holdings Limited 2008 Performance Incentive Plan&#148; (the &#147;New Plan&#148;). Subject to any amendment of the New Plan, the maximum number of ordinary shares that may be issued pursuant to the New Plan is equal to
	5% of the total number of ordinary shares issued and outstanding as of August&nbsp;4, 2008, plus an automatic annual increase on October&nbsp;1 of each calendar year commencing with October&nbsp;1, 2008, by an amount equal to the lesser of (i) 1% of
	the total number of ordinary shares issued and outstanding on September&nbsp;30 of the same calendar year, or (ii)&nbsp;such number of ordinary shares as may be determined by the Company&#146;s board of directors. The purpose of these share
	incentive plans is to promote the success of the Company and the interests of its shareholders by providing a means through which the Company may grant equity-based incentives to attract, motivate, retain and reward certain officers, employees,
	directors and other eligible persons and to further link the interests of recipients with those of the Company&#146;s shareholders generally. The Prior Plan will expire on April&nbsp;17, 2018. The New Plan will expire on the tenth anniversary date
	of August&nbsp;4, 2008. Option awards are generally granted with an exercise price equal to the market price of the Company&#146;s stock at the date of grant; those option awards generally vest within 4 years of continuous service and have
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-year
</FONT>
	contractual terms. Share awards generally vest for 1 year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On May&nbsp;21, 2013, the
	Company&#146;s board of directors and compensation committee approved to cancel 400,000 options that were granted to the five directors on December&nbsp;2, 2008 with an exercise price per share equal to US$0.615. Since these options were fully
	vested and the corresponding share-based compensation was recognized before the cancellation date, no expense related to such options was recorded in the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By the same resolution of the board of directors on May&nbsp;21, 2013, 720,900 options that were granted to the selected employees on
	November&nbsp;17, 2009 with an exercise price per share equal to US$1.87 were cancelled. This cancellation resulted in an immediate recording of the remaining share-based compensation of US$146 in the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;18, 2014, the Company&#146;s board of directors approved to grant to certain employees 2,800,000 share options for an exercise
	price per share at US$3.74. These options shall vest subject to a four-year vesting schedule with 25% vesting in each year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-61
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHINA DISTANCE EDUCATION HOLDINGS LIMITED
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, 2015 AND 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(In thousands, except share and per share data, or otherwise noted)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	24.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHARE INCENTIVE PLAN - continued
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Share options
</I>
</B>
	- continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;11, 2015, the Company declared a cash dividend of US$0.225 per ordinary
	share on its outstanding shares to shareholders as of January&nbsp;6, 2016. According to the terms of the Prior and New Plan, the exercise price was duly reduced by US$0.225 for all of the outstanding options as of January&nbsp;6, 2016. The change
	in exercise price incurred in the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, and therefore was not reflected in the weighted-average exercise price as of September&nbsp;30, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016 were US$3,906, US$317, and US$372,
	respectively. As of September&nbsp;30, 2016, the unrecognized share-based compensation cost related to share options amounted to approximately US$1,941. This compensation cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average vesting period of
	2.13 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value of options granted on November&nbsp;18, 2014 was estimated on the date of grant using the binomial option
	pricing model with the following assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_61"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="78%">
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Nonvested restricted shares
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On December&nbsp;3, 2014, the Company granted 125,000 nonvested restricted shares of the Company to its directors. These shares are restricted
	on transferability and will be forfeited if the directors cease to provide requisite service to the Company. The restriction will be removed upon the vesting of the nonvested restricted shares on the first anniversary of the issuance day. Before the
	removal of such restrictions, the holders of the nonvested shares shall be entitled to all rights and privileges of those of ordinary shareholders, and shall be entitled to voting rights and dividends. Therefore, these nonvested shares are
	considered participating securities for the purpose of net earnings per share calculation. The grant-date value of a nonvested restricted share was US$4.53, which was determined based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s ADSs on NYSE on
	December&nbsp;3, 2014. This grant resulted in a total share-based compensation of US$566, which was recognized ratably over the requisite service period of one year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-63
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage191"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHINA DISTANCE EDUCATION HOLDINGS LIMITED
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, 2015 AND 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(In thousands, except share and per share data, or otherwise noted)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	24.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHARE INCENTIVE PLAN - continued
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Nonvested restricted shares
</I>
</B>
	- continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;12, 2015, the Company granted 542,372 nonvested restricted shares. These
	nonvested restricted shares are subject to a four-year vesting period with 25% vesting on the first anniversary of the issuance date and the remaining 75% vesting in six substantially equal semi-annual installments. Before the removal of restriction
	on the transferability, the holder of the nonvested shares shall be entitled to all rights and privileges of those of ordinary shareholders, and shall be entitled to voting rights and dividends. Therefore, these nonvested shares are considered
	participating securities for the purpose of net earnings per share calculation. The grant-date value of a nonvested restricted share was US$3.6875, which was determined based the closing price of the Company&#146;s ASDs on NYSE on January&nbsp;12,
	2015. This grant resulted in a total share-based compensation of US$2,000, to be recognized ratably over the requisite service period of four years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On December&nbsp;3, 2015, the Company granted 125,000 nonvested restricted shares of the Company to its directors. These shares are restricted
	on transferability and will be forfeited if the directors cease to provide requisite service to the Company. The restriction will be removed upon the vesting of the nonvested restricted shares on the first anniversary of the issuance day. Before the
	removal of such restrictions, the holders of the nonvested shares shall be entitled to all rights and privileges of those of ordinary shareholders, and shall be entitled to voting rights and dividends. Therefore, these nonvested shares are
	considered participating securities for the purpose of net earnings per share calculation. The grant-date value of a nonvested restricted share was US$3.8125, which was determined based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s ADSs on NYSE on
	December&nbsp;3, 2015. This grant resulted in a total share-based compensation of US$477, which was recognized ratably over the requisite service period of one year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A summary of the nonvested restricted shares activities for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Nonvested restricted shares
</I>
</B>
	- continued
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total fair value of nonvested restricted shares vested during the years ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016 were US$153, US$573 and US$1,316, respectively. The Company recorded share-based compensation expenses of US$503, US$921 and US$992 for the years ended September 30, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively. As of
	September 30, 2016, there was US$1,225 of share-based compensation related to nonvested shares that is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.2 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	non-employees

	and

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;20, 2013, the Company approved and declared a cash
	dividend of US$0.15 per ordinary share on its total 136,409,633 outstanding shares as of the close of trading on January&nbsp;8, 2014, resulting in payments totaling US$20,258 to shareholders. Such dividend was recorded as a reduction against
	retained earnings to the extent of the balance as of November&nbsp;20, 2013 retained by the Company&#146;s wholly owned subsidiaries in the PRC and then as a reduction against additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-in
</FONT>
	capital for
	the remainder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;18, 2014, the Company approved and declared a cash dividend of US$0.20 per ordinary share on its total
	142,878,373 outstanding shares as of the close of trading on January&nbsp;6, 2015, resulting in payments totaling US$28,199 to shareholders. Such dividend was recorded as a reduction against retained earnings to the extent of the balance as of
	November&nbsp;18, 2014 retained by the Company&#146;s wholly owned subsidiaries in the PRC and then as a reduction against additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-in
</FONT>
	capital for the remainder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-65

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;11, 2015, the Company approved and declared a cash dividend of US$0.225 per
	ordinary share on its total 140,219,033 outstanding shares as of the close of trading on January&nbsp;6, 2016, resulting in payments totaling US$31,138 to shareholders. Such dividend was recorded as a reduction against retained earnings to the
	extent of the balance as of November&nbsp;11, 2015 retained by the Company&#146;s wholly owned subsidiaries in the PRC and then as a reduction against additional
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	paid-in
</FONT>
	capital for the remainder.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	26.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In October 2016, the Group incorporated Beijing Champion
	International Education Technology Co., Ltd., or Champion Int&#146;l Education, and plans to introduce international education products and services. The Group believes that the incorporation of this new entity would not result in any substantive
	impact on its operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In October 2016, Zhengbao Yucai announced a share issuance plan on China&#146;s New Third Board. Under the plan,
	Zhengbao Yucai plans to issue no more than 41,880,000 common shares, representing 40.5% of the total outstanding shares of Zhengbao Yucai immediately after the share issuance, to be priced at RMB1.91 per common share. Total fund raised by the share
	issuance is expected to be no more than RMB80.0&nbsp;million (US$11,429). The proceeds from this share issuance are expected to be used for working capital and business development, which includes mergers or acquisitions of complementary businesses
	focused on China&#146;s college market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November 2016, the Group subscribed for 7.242% equity interest in Nurselink International
	Limited, or Nurselink Int&#146;l, a company engaged in nurse recruiting and training service, in two rounds at the total consideration of US$911. The first round of the investment was completed in November 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;29, 2016, the Company approved and declared a special cash dividend of US$0.1125 per ordinary share on its outstanding shares
	to shareholders of record as of the close of trading on January&nbsp;6, 2017. Holders of ADS, each representing four ordinary shares of CDEL, are accordingly entitled to the cash dividend of US$0.45 per ADS. The depository, Deutsche Bank Trust
	Company Americas, will charge a fee of US$0.02 per ADS when the dividends are distributed on or about January&nbsp;13, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November
	2016, the Group invested S$0.9&nbsp;million (US$658) for an additional 6.82% equity interest of Amdon (Note 11(a)). Subsequent to this investment, the Group held 15%, in aggregate, equity interest in Amdon.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-66
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS - continued

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On December&nbsp;8, 2016, Zhengbao Yucai delivered a revised share issuance plan
	(&#147;Revised Plan&#148;) to China&#146;s New Third Board. Under the Revised Plan, Zhengbao Yucai plans to issue no more than 41,880,000 common shares, representing 40.5% of the total outstanding shares of Zhengbao Yucai immediately after the share
	issuance, at a price of RMB1.99 per common share, an increase from RMB1.91 per common share proposed under the prior plan. Total fund raised by the share issuance is expected to be no more than RMB83.3&nbsp;million (US$11,900), an increase from
	RMB80.0&nbsp;million proposed under the prior plan. Pursuant to the Revised Plan, Mr.&nbsp;Zhengdong Zhu, chairman and CEO of CDEL, and Mr.&nbsp;Liankui Hu, an independent director of CDEL, will subscribe 63.8% and 24.6%, respectively, of the total
	shares to be issued.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Immediately following the share issuance, the equity interest of CDEL in Zhengbao Yucai will be reduced from 60.1% to
	35.8%, and Mr.&nbsp;Zhu, Mr.&nbsp;Hu, and a partnership in which Mr.&nbsp;Zhu holds a majority of the partnership interests will collectively have a combined equity interest in Zhengbao Yucai of 59.5%. Mr.&nbsp;Zhu, Mr.&nbsp;Hu, and the partnership
	have entered into an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	acting-in-concert
</FONT>
</FONT>
	agreement with a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company through which CDEL holds its shares in Zhengbao Yucai, requiring them to
	vote their shares as to key matters put before the shareholders in accordance with the instructions of such subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	December&nbsp;23, 2016, a loan agreement under the Revolving Term Loan Facility with BEA (Note 15) was terminated and replaced by a new loan agreement, at the amount of $14,900, with BEA and the same maturity date. The loan bears interest rate at
	approximately 1.997%, subject to adjustment each quarter. And, in connection with the new loan agreement, an additional term deposit of US$1,740 was made. In addition, US$15,000 of the facility was drawn down on December&nbsp;23, 2016 at
	approximately 1.997% interest rate, subject to adjustment each quarter, for a term of 12 months. The facility was secured by a term deposit of RMB116.7&nbsp;million (US$17,500) provided by Champion Technology.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2017, the Group entered into a share transfer agreement with certain shareholders of Hangzhou Wanting Technology Co., Ltd., or
	Hangzhou Wanting, to purchase 10.0% equity interest in Hangzhou Wanting at the consideration of RMB16.0&nbsp;million (US$2,400). Hangzhou Wanting is a listed company on the New Third Board which offers comprehensive simulation-based learning
	opportunities to college students to master critical engineering and construction skills.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-67

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D202937D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHINA DISTANCE EDUCATION HOLDINGS LIMITED
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Additional Information - Financial Statement Schedule I
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Condensed Financial Information of Parent Company
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(U.S. dollars in thousands, except share data and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	BASIS FOR PREPARATION
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The condensed financial information of the Parent Company has
	been prepared using the same accounting policies as set out in the Group&#146;s consolidated financial statements except that the Parent Company used the equity method to account for investments in its subsidiaries and VIEs. The condensed financial
	information is provided since the restricted net assets of the Group&#146;s subsidiaries, VIEs and VIEs&#146; subsidiaries were over the 25% of the consolidated net assets of the Group as of September&nbsp;30, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	INVESTMENTS IN SUBSIDIARIES AND VIE
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In its consolidated financial statements, the
	Parent Company consolidates the results of operations and assets and liabilities of its subsidiaries, VIEs and VIEs&#146; subsidiaries, and inter-company balances and transactions were eliminated upon consolidation. For the purpose of the Parent
	Company&#146;s standalone financial statements, its investments in subsidiaries are reported using the equity method of accounting as a single line item and the Parent Company&#146;s share of income from its subsidiaries are reported as the single
	line item of equity in income of subsidiaries and variable interest entities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Parent Company carried the investments in subsidiaries
	and VIEs at US$110,401 and US$132,150 at September&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Parent Company&#146;s share of equity in
	income in subsidiaries and the VIEs recognized in years ended September&nbsp;30, 2014, 2015 and 2016 was US$24,627, US$26,910 and US$27,902, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-73
</P>
</EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
</EFX_FORM>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage201"></A>
<A NAME="D202937DEX81_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_8>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_8"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 8.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Subsidiaries of Registrant
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<B>
	Exhibit 12.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Certification by the Chief Executive Officer
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;302 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I, Zhengdong Zhu, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	20-F
</FONT>
	of China Distance Education Holdings Limited;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such
	statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the
	company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(e)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(e))
</FONT>
	and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(f)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(f))
</FONT>
	for the
	company and have:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its
	consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of
	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
	period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
	materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the
	company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process,
	summarize and report financial information; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 12.2
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Certification by the Chief Financial Officers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;302 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We, Mark Marostica and Philip Chan, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	20-F
</FONT>
	of China Distance Education Holdings Limited;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such
	statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the
	company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(e)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(e))
</FONT>
	and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	13a-15(f)
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15d-15(f))
</FONT>
	for the
	company and have:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its
	consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of
	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
	period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
	materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the
	company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&#146;s ability to record, process,
	summarize and report financial information; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</TD>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_13>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_13"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 13.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Certification by the Chief Executive Officer
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &#167; 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, Zhengdong Zhu, Chief Executive
	Officer of China Distance Education Holdings Limited (the &#147;Company&#148;), hereby certifies, to the best of his knowledge, that the Company&#146;s annual report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	20-F
</FONT>
	for the year ended
	September&nbsp;30, 2016 (the &#147;Report&#148;) fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and that the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all
	material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company as of, and for the periods presented in the Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date:
	January&nbsp;25, 2017
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_13>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_13_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 13.2
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Certification by the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Financial Officers
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &#167; 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, Mark Marostica and Philip Chan,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Co-Chief
</FONT>
	Financial Officers of China Distance Education Holdings Limited (the &#147;Company&#148;), hereby certify, to the best of their knowledge, that the Company&#146;s annual report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	20-F
</FONT>
	for the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 (the &#147;Report&#148;) fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and that the
	information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company as of, and for the periods presented in the Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: January&nbsp;25, 2017
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	of our reports dated January&nbsp;25, 2017 relating to the consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule of China Distance Education Holdings Limited, its subsidiaries, variable interest
	entities and the subsidiaries of their variable interest entities (collectively, the &#147;Group&#148;) and the effectiveness of the Group&#146;s internal control over financial reporting, appearing in this Annual Report on Form

	20-F

	of China Distance Education Holdings Limited for the year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016.

	Exhibit 15.2
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	January&nbsp;25, 2017
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	China Distance Education Holdings
	Limited (the &#147;
<B>
	Company
</B>
	&#148;)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18th Floor, Xueyuan International Tower
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1 Zhichun Road, Haidian District
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Beijing 100083, People&#146;s
	Republic of China
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have acted as
	legal advisors as to the laws of the People&#146;s Republic of China to the Company in connection with the filing by the Company with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission of an annual report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	20-F
</FONT>
	for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30, 2016 and any amendments thereto (the &#147;Annual Report&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We hereby consent to the use and reference to our name and our opinions and views in the Annual Report. We further consent to the filing of this letter as an
	exhibit to the Annual Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In giving such consent, we do not thereby admit that we come within the category of persons whose consent is required under
	Section&nbsp;7 of the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the regulations promulgated thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sincerely yours,
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
